abstract: Apple scrambled to limit the damage caused by MobileMe, the company’s first step into cloud computing, by posting an apology and acknowledging continuing problems.
snippet: Apple scrambled to limit the damage caused by MobileMe, the company’s first step into cloud computing, by posting an apology and acknowledging continuing problems.
lead_paragraph: UPDATED 7/28/08 1:55 a.m.  On Sunday evening Apple posted a short update to the MobileMe situation. According to a post from an Apple employee who identified himself as “David G.,” e-mail to the 1 percent of MobileMe users who have been without mail service was turned on again on Saturday and “feedback has been cautiously positive.” But everything is not perfect, as 10 percent of the mail that these users received between July 18 and July 22 “may have been lost.” Another update was promised early in the week.

headline.main: We’re Really Sorry, Says Apple, Really We Are
